Reviews.Title: “J and B, Scotland”
Reviews.Author: Jim R
Reviews.Content: Very easy to access from C de Gaulle on RER and Metro. Reception area very impressive and room very clean and reasonably sized. Also, shower room and separate toilet spotless. Stayed 4 nights, clean towels daily, bed and shower room, toilet always thoroughly cleaned. Maybe a small washbasin in toilet would have been better. Staff on reception very friendly and spoke good English. Plenty eating places around, and a very good buffet breakfast at hotel. Fifth visit to Paris, best hotel yet.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Nunchuckas_McCool
Reviews.Content: After trawling through hotel sites and looking for a hotel close to the metro in a nice area I ended up choosing this one. I have no idea why anyone has put anything negative about this place. It was spotless and did look like it had just have a makeover. The rooms were not small, there was plenty of room. The shower as someone put earlier is worth the money alone!! It is a ten minute walk to the arc de triomphe, a 30 second walk to the metro station and a 5 minute walk from a lovely set of about 20 restaurant with plenty to choose from! We paid about £90 a night on the rugby weekend with an all you can manage conto mental style breakfast which was lovely. I can't rate it highly enough. Well done guys and girls

Reviews.Title: “great priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: ja27swindon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 31/01/12 to 04/02/12 paid £320 for the 4 nights which for paris represented good value, it was very clean and efficient plus very warm (outside was about -10 ) the breakfasts were good ,position ideal with a metro stop a few yards away for anyone who wants a short break in paris without paying the earth and does not expect 5 star luxury this hotel is great

Reviews.Title: “very good value.....”
Reviews.Author: sashyMidlands
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first stay in Paris. This hotel was very clean and located in a quiet but good area for restaurants only a short walk down the road. The Du17eme is excellent value for money considering the price seen advertised in other restaurants.The renovation work is still going on but as it was the xmas period we did not experience any being done. The breakfast was adequate although on our last morning due to going later some items had ran out and there was a queque for tables. All in all a good hotel very near to 2 metro stations would use again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for both business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Tanya19
Reviews.Content: The Champerret Elysees hotel is, perhaps, what a standard hotel should be. It won't blow you away with awesome amenities or fabulous decor. The owners and the staff at this hotel, however, certainly work hard to ensure that your stay is a pleasant one. We recently stayed at the Champerret Elysees while on a business trip. In fact, my husband regularly selects this hotel while in Paris for business. The hotel is steps away from the Porte de Champerret metro station, with easy connections to various points of interest within the city. I believe the hotel is under renovation. There have been changes to the wall coverings; bathrooms have been updated -- really good showers! -- and carpets have been changed. As for the breakfast, sometimes we have breakfast at the hotel; however, with bistros down the street at Place Marechal Juin (one metro stop away at Perreire), you have a few options available to you. In terms of room size, the hotel has at least three different room categories. Of course, the price differs from category to category. Also, as is common in Paris (and in France and in most of Europe), hotels that operate in older buildings tend to have a higher ratio of small rooms. An economy/standard room in North America tends to be larger than on in France. On our recent stay we had a standard room which was just large enough for a double bed and a small desk. (The desk wasn't really useful as there was about 1.5 feet between the foot of the bed and the desk.) The same is true for the bathroom. Two people could just about fit comfortably. However, the bathroom was clean and recently renovated so no complaints. All in all, the Champerret Elysees is very good base when staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel, right near Metro”
Reviews.Author: mcwelly
Reviews.Content: Sorry, left it late to write a review, we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as part of a Eurostar deal in May. Clean, convenient, polite & helpful staff. Room was adequate for our needs, not overly big and with no view. However we didn't go to Paris to stay in the room! Breakfast was good and plentiful. Location was very good, right near metro, not far from a small market. Several decent restaurants nearby. Downside, if you could call it that - they were in the middle of re-decorating and small corridors were cluttered at times, however this is temporary I'm sure, so no detriment to our stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemike63
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated in a fairly quiet area, with good transport options close by. I had read earlier reviews but was not prepared for how tiny the room was. The room itself was adequate, with time mainly spent exploring this great city. The room was clean and staff very helpful, including arranging new shuttle to the airport after previous booking was unable to be contacted. There are a number of good restaurants and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, in a good non-touristy location”
Reviews.Author: MortonFan
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel courtesy of Airmiles (taking advantage of a last completely free trip before they switch over to Avios). So, while it wouldn't necessarily have been my choice, I was pleasantly surprised. Previous Trip Advisor reviews dating back to July highlighted that a major refurb was taking place, and so I figured that it had to be pretty much complete by Nov (it was - minor paintwork still happening). All in all, this was a good hotel in a good location - my pros and cons are summarised below: Pros - staff; really friendly and helpful, all spoke good English. Guy at front desk helped me connect to the hotel's free wifi (just ask for your password, it's made up your room number and letters from your name.) They also let us check in for our return flights and print off our boarding passes. Desk is manned 24 hours. Breakfast; very good selection of bread, pastries, cold meat, eggs, jams, etc - it was included in our rate, but if it hadn't been, we prob would have gone out. Tea / coffee was from a machine and the coffee was poor. Location; 1 minute walk from Porte de Champerret metro, 3 mins from Pereire metro. Nice, upmarket, classic French neighbourhood. Lots of great cafes and bistros nearby with very few tourists around. We found it better to do the sightseeing in the centre and come back to eat dinner near the hotel. The hotel may recommend Bistrot du 17e just beyond Place Marechal Juin, and it was fine, but you can prob find better value nearby (fixed price, 3 courses w/wine and coffee was 42 euros per head). Cleanliness / comfort; room was clean, as was bathroom, dining room and other common areas. Bed comfy, linen new and good quality. New tiles / fittings in bathroom. Cons - Toilet: this wasn't actually IN the bathroom! It was in a separate 'cupboard' (very small and tight for space) with no wash hand basin. Kind of odd - think if I'd been staying more than 2 nights we would have asked if another room with full bath was available. Long trip in from airport: while the hotel is pretty well connected, getting there from CDG was a bit of a schlep. You come into Gare du Nord, then it's an RER train, then metro line 3. Do your research on the connections first (there's lots of different levels / lines) and if at all possible buy your tix in advance because you really do want to look like you know where you're going. Having said all that, with a bit of nous and confidence it's no problem to negotiate the metro / RER.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: jamie198522
Reviews.Content: was an ok hotel thats about it, room was very small, one of the smallest rooms iv stayed in but was nice n clean... £8 to watch a film on the telly... i know your not there to watch telly but after a long day out its nice to come back and relax and watch a film or some telly... only bbc news in english, breakfast was ok again, continental... nothing special,good location id say, metro line across the road witch takes you everywhere... hotel staff are all friendly.... local area is very safe....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nadav z
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at this hotel. The room is a bit small,but reasonably sized for Paris. The room was kept clean every day. Although the room is located on a main road, the window are perfectly sealed for noise. The shower and bathroom were clean and easy to use. Most important thing, is that the receptionists were very nice and helpful, each question was answered politely and with a smile on their faces. The hotel is located very close to a metro and RER station,which makes the traveling much easier. there's also a bus station with many lines to basicly every tourists sites. Excellent location, about 10 minutes to Champ Elysees and the Arc of Triumph. Most recommended and would be happy to stay there again. Thank you for the lovely hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_flying
Reviews.Content: Positives: Very clean room and a reasonable size for Paris. Recently renovated. Close to Metro and RER lines and walking distance to Arc de Triomphe. Good value for money with breakfast included. Try the Bistro de 17eme at nearby Pereire - they offer a great value and delicious set menu! Reception were happy to assist with any queries - very helpful. Negatives: Only 2 TV channels (as far as we could work out!): an adult channel and a Moroocan channel! However, to be fair, we never asked for assistance with retuning and who comes to Paris to watch TV anyway?! When breakfast ended the waitress rather brusquely asked everyone to leave - no leeway whatsoever. A bit unnecessary and not great customer service but the breakfast itself more than adequate. Overall: I'd recommend this hotel as it is clean, recently renovated and near the Metro - good value for money. Small gripes only and not enough to detract from an overall positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good and sufficient!”
Reviews.Author: katerinaAthens
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 nights in this small and lovely hotel. Its location is quite convenient just a few steps from the metro (ligne ponte de Levallois) metro station Porte de Champerret. You can walk to to the Arc de Triomphe and its about a 20 minutes walk. First of all the area around the hotel is very nice, very classy, typical parisian area. The bus stops also just outside the hotel and you can catch it to go to the centre. Unfortunately we didn't take it so I cant give you some advise. To get to the hotel from the airport is a little bit complicated and if you travel with a lot of bags very uncomfortable. It takes around 1 hour and a half to get you to the hotel...The hotel is also not quite in the centre of Paris but with the metro it takes you just twenty minutes less, or more to the centre. Second of all the hotel is very clean, the rooms are small enough but efficient. We would appreciate a small refrigerator in the room and also maybe a chance to get your coffee or tea in the room would be much appreciated. We didn't get breakfast at the hotel, I think its overated. We did get our breakfast in the two small cafe next to the hotel, typical parisien with a lot of Paris citizents inside with just 7 euro per person, and it was just ok to start your day. We had once take a taxi as we heard that it was very expensive but it wasn't. We took it from Tour Eiffel 15 arrondisement to the hotel with just 13 euros. Paris is a very expensive city, as we all know. Cafe o lait in a cafe in Champs Elysees with 8 euros!!! A tip for the hotel, if you want a view and also quiet try to book one in the opposite road. It's just perfect... A tip for Tour Eiffel and Louvro museum, try to book your ticket online and not waist hours and hours waiting to get in. And not forget to take a trip to the river with a bateaux mousse... Also try some classique french cuisine, its magnifique!!! I forgot to mention that the guys in the reception are very nice, very helpfull and speak very good english. Overall a nice stay! I would recommend this hotel to my friends. Hope I helped a little. Katerina, Athens

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Josie M
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 4 night stay in Champerret Elysees. The hotel is in an excellent position for the Metro and Bus station both of which offer very good services. The Arc de Triomphe is approx 15 mins walk away. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. The room itself, although fairly small was adequate for our needs and again was very clean. One bit of advise if you travel by air and land at Charles De Galle airport on a Friday evening, it might be worth considering getting the train rather than a taxi/shuttle service as we sat in Friday night traffic for two hours trying to get to the hotel. Also take plenty of money because Paris is not cheap but is a wonderful city with lots of things to see and do. If we return to Paris in the future I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Don't book through priceline”
Reviews.Author: ac2390
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and were told by their (priceline's) staff that we were getting a room with one queen and 2 double beds. One of two things happened. Either they had such a room and the hotel wanted to get more money from us, or customer service at priceline was entirely wrong in their room descriptions. When we got there, we were forced to buy two rooms, one for us and one for our children, doubling the cost of the trip. I suppose it's not fair to compare hotels in Paris to hotels in the US, but I felt it was very pricey for a room with less amenities than a motel 6. My parents were with us and given a room on a floor under construction that reeked of paint and new carpet and was downright dangerous to get to (construction supplies all over the place). They honored my parents' request to change rooms. The rooms we got were on ground level, behind the front desk. A bit of an awkward arrangement. Do not expect to get more than one person and a piece of luggage onto the elevator. The rooms themselves were clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location, in depth review from tourist point of view.”
Reviews.Author: CityGuidepdf
Reviews.Content: We were a couple, stayed 5 nights, first time in Paris and the review is in depth for other first time travelers. April was a good month to travel, not only was the weather good, we also got good bargains everywhere. Rooms - The rooms are just perfect for a couple, clean & well done. One of the best showers. The staff at the reception is very warm and welcoming, make you feel at home. Luggage Room - Since we were travelling to Amsterdam and Brussels for 5 days we decided to keep one of our strollers behind at the hotel which they gladly kept. Thanks for the same as it made our life easier. Location - The hotel is about 3 minutes walking distance from the Pereire Metro station and 5 minutes from the Pereire Levallois RER station (which is an added advantage). Between the two stations you can choose any one depending on where you plan to go. Local Travel - In Paris the only way to go around is by Metro which is very easy to understand. We did not buy any travel passes. We used to buy a set of 10 tickets, called carnet (works out cheaper instead of buying a single ticket and saves time), just punch as you go, very easy. If you plan to go to Versailles and Disney buy the open tickets along with the carnet, to save time. Neighbourhood - There are plenty of restaurants at 2-3 minutes walking distance to suit all budgets and tastes. The hotel is in a very safe neighbourhood and we were comfortable walking up to the hotel even at late hours from the metro station. Nightlife-Paris has a great nightlife especially on weekends (moreover most city hotels are cheaper on weekends) so ensure that you have a weekend included in your stay. Disney - Register yourself at Disney Paris website a few weeks before you travel, they will mail you discount offers, avail the offer and book the tickets in advance to avoid long queues at the entrance. Personally I would avoid wasting a day at Disney, far too crowded and we could hardly do 2-3 rides, inspite of our choosing a weekday. Eiffel Tower - Go right upto The Summit (top most level) as you are going to do it once in lifetime. The best time to go is at sunset, check on the net at what time the sun will set in Paris during your week of travel, and reserve the slot accordingly. We were glad that we had booked our tickets online weeks in advance as there was a separate entry (can say VIP entry). People were standing in queue for 2 hours to buy the tickets and moreover tickets to The Summit were suspended as there was congestion at The Summit. Seine River Cruise - Best to do after dark so that you can see the monuments lit up specially sparking Eiffel. Book your tickets in advance to save time as there can be long queues. We opted for "vedettesdupontneuf" as it offered very good discounts when booked on internet. Will surely visit Paris again and would love to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: helena4141
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay in this hotel as a family of 9. I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Paris throughout the years and most have been very basic and disappointing . The hotel didn't really look much from the outside , but as soon as we saw our rooms, we were not disappointed. They were very nicely decorated , clean and had an excellent shower & air conditioning too. We booked 4 rooms altogether . The staff were very friendly and helpful. The metro just a few steps away . It had plenty of shops around and even a Mcdonalds nearby. A quiet , safe area even at night , and only 20 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable option”
Reviews.Author: Gmurphyjcap
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at this convenient (to Metro) hotel. The room was VERY small but otherwise met all our needs. Everything was clean, tidy, attractive, etc. Staff was polite and helpful. While not centrally located, the proximity to the very efficient Metro system made this a great location. We enjoyed being in a neighborhood slightly off the normal tourist route that still offered pleasant options for eating and shopping. Would definitely return to this hotel; might consider paying a bit more for one of their more spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: El1Yorkshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right next to the metro station, which i would reccommend you use as it is very reliable, and once we figured out how it worked we hopped on and off the trains all weekend. It is also only about a twenty minute walk from the arc de triomphe. The rooms are clean and perfectly adequate for a weekend in paris. The shower in the room is amazing, it has different settings and water jets! The continental breakfast was very nice and the staff were friendly, they gave us maps and recommending places to eat. The hotel is on a busy road so it is quite noisy on a night time, its not too bad if you shut the windows, but on a hot night time in June we didn't have much choice but to leave them open. Overall i would deffinatly reccommend this hotel as a great base for people wanting to spend a long weekend exploring paris.

Reviews.Title: “Uninhabitable”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreEM
Reviews.Content: I recently booked four days at the Champerret Elysees Paris through Hotel Direct and I was shocked. I realize I paid a discount rate, but I did not realize that the reason for the discount is that the hotel was uninhabitable. The hotel was undergoing major renovations. It was very noisy and our room smelled strongly of paint. I opened the window to air it out but the courtyard was filled with paint cans and smoking workmen so the smell was worse. At one point a workman actually let him self into our room while I was in the bath and my husband was having a nap. Had I been informed that the hotel was undergoing renovations, I would have chosen to pay full price somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: DocNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Was after a reasonable hotel that could accommodate our 11 year old in the room with us. The hotel was able to supply a rollaway bed. Was recommended by the travel company we used and we weren't disappointed. Good continental breakfast and they could also book various tourist excursions.Had wireless internet in your room if you had your own laptop. What did impress me was that the internet was free. Very close to metro. Plenty of eating establisments nearby( including McDonalds and Subway for the budget conscious traveller.)

Reviews.Title: “Charming typically French hotel- great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lisky84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2011 for a 3 night break with my mum for her birthday. The hotel seems small a tired from the outside but when entering we could see it had had recent refurbishment. The rooms are spacious and very clean, the bathrooms are all newly refurbed and decorated. The rooms are a basic but with new bedding and curtains, there's a flat screen TV, free WiFi connection, telephone and hairdryer all the amenities needed. The reception staff are happy to answer questions about different districts to visit and restaurants, directions any general questions they will attempt to answer all spoke good English and were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served in the basement in a nice room on a self-serve basis there is a good selection of continental style food- croissants, bread, cheese, ham, jams and cereal, with tea, coffee, hot chocolate and orange juice available! All really nice quality stuff good to make things a little cheaper as food in Paris can be expensive. All in all this hotel is excellent value for money I have no complaints with it at all! It had a great location just 25 min walk to the Arc De Triomphe which continues down the Champs-D'Elysees and across the river from here the Eiffel Tower. But walking can take it's toll as there is so much to see but the hotel is a 2 min walk from the metro line Porte de Champerret which had links to the other metro lines so getting around Paris us easy! Would recommend the Louvre, Eiffel towere and Montmarte definite must sees!! Hotel is great!!! Had a fantastic trip!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoiraHull_11
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on Trip adviser and were not disappointed. Paid £99 per night for double room with space for clothes and comfortable beds. Bathroom compact with power shower and separate toilet. Close to metro and bus station. 20 minutes walk to Arc de Triomphe. Helpful, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Aarobles
Reviews.Content: We were on a limited budget so I didn't have really high expectations about the hotel . So it was a pleasant surprise to see that the room was rather nice and the bathroom was clean with new fixtures. Location of the hotel is very good..literally a minute ( or less) walk from the metro train and the bus station so we didn't have to use the taxi service at all. A good 10-15 min walk from arc de triomphe, nice restaurants near the hotel so we were able to make the most of every minute of our trip. Breakfast not included though. Staff was very friendly, spoke english and helpful with directions etc. Free wi fi. Will definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: janelizHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May. Haven't been to Paris for over 30 years, so bit worried about how we would find our way around a big city! We bought our 5 day Metro pass in London at the Eurostar terminal and I'm glad we did as ticket office at the Metro station was unmanned? Anyway we made our own way from Paris GDN to the Hotel on the Metro. It was very close to the Bus Station and the Metro, so ideally located for getting around. Again had read up on Trip Advisor before we went and happy to see good reports! We had a room overlooking the main road but the double glazing was excellent so no noise at all. The room was very clean and comfortable.The hotel is having some decorating work done but it didn't interfere with us. We found all the staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was a perfectly adequate continental one. What makes this hotel stand out though I guess is it's location. We used the Metro and walked to a lot of the attractions. The only thing that disappointed us was the quality of the food in the local restaurants. This is Paris?? Thought French food was supposed to be top notch? It was terribly expensive, we weren't getting much change from £100 for a very average meal, (seemed everything was with chips) and bottle of average wine. The best meal we had was in the Thai Restaurant just up the road from the Hotel. Pricey again, but at least we enjoyed it! But back to the Hotel, would highly recommend it and go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - clean friendly and quiet”
Reviews.Author: lovehols09
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. We found the hotel easily after a 15-20min walk from the bus stop at Porte Maillot after a flight to Bouvais airport. The metro is also minutes from the hotel door and the hotel is just inside zone 1 so trips usually cost £1.20 (book of 10 tickets bought at the metro). Hotel staff were friendly and spoke good english. They were very helpful. Room was at the back of the hotel (207) and was small but clean and totally adequate for our needs as we only used it to sleep. Breakfast was fine - cereal, cheeses, cold meats, croissants toast fruit jam , lovely coffee. Would definetly reccomend this hotel for short breaks

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kupocat
Reviews.Content: I stayed in here in Oct 2010 with my boyfriend.....a surprise trip to celebrate out 2nd anniversary together. Getting to the hotle from the a Gare De Nord was fine, we used the tube which is fairly easy to understand once you've made your first journey! What a lovely hotel, the staff spoke very good English, it was very clean and tidy. The room was a perfect size and very quiet. Breakfast was generally good, it's just a cold buffet with lovely croissants, toast and cereal etc. Considering it's served in the basement of the hotel its a really lovely room, very light and airy with murals painted on the walls. I would definately return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Closer to the centre than you think”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover00
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with helpful English speaking staff, our room was large by Parisian standards with an amazing multi nozzle shower and bath. Basic breakfast was fine, lovely croissants

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: LCatherine18
Reviews.Content: We booked are long weekend away through an air miles travel agency for my 18th birthday present. I was not sure what to expect on the arrival of our hotel as there has been mixed reviews, however we were pleasantly surprised. As soon as we walked through the entrance we were greeted by the receptionist who spoke very good English and gave us our room key. The bedroom was small-ish however this was not a problem as it was only somewhere to crash. The en-suite was excellent, looked recently refurbished; the power shower also came with water jets!! We didn’t have any problems with hot water either. The room also came with a safe and a flat screen TV. Breakfast was served between 7 and 10 o’clock. There was a great variety of cereals, different types of bread that you could put through the toaster, croissants, yogurts, bread rolls, ham/cheese, fruit salad, jams, orange juice, water, milk and plenty of hot drinks. The metro is situated about a 1 minute walk away which is very easy to use. We also used the local buses as well. We brought a 3day travel pass in order to use the metro and buses but only from zones 1 to 3 which was not a problem as these zones cover the main part of Paris. We also did a lot of walking, this way you get to see more of Paris’s back roads. The Arc De Triomphe was about a 10-15 minute walk away which then takes you to the Champs Elysee. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants good value for money and wants a great location.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethAdam
Reviews.Content: I booked up this hotel through Airmiles Travel Agency, and got a very good deal with the Eurostar included. We were in a front room over-looking the main road, but the double glazing was excellent and we did not hear any noise at all.The room was very clean and the breakfast room spotless, There was plenty of choice for breakfast. There were plenty of bars and restaurants in the vicinity, and also supermarkets for water or if you wanted to pick up a sandwich or make your own rolls. Recomended if on a tight budget, as the food and drink can be very expensive. Metro very close by, which is excellent and easy to use and cheap, but we also walked as you can see more if you do that.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: enjoysummers
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3rd floor in room 309 after requesting a quiet room as hotel is on a fairly busy road. The room was at the back and there was next to no noise from outside however you could hear everything from the adjoining room. From the running of a shower, going to the toilet, talking on the phone to snoring. Maybe we were unlucky to have such a noisy neighbour that said the walls must be fairly thin. The breakfast was ok with plenty of room in the small basement dining room at 8am but it was a bit boring after day two. It was only 100 metres from metro and very easy to get around the city which was its best point. Staff were not that friendly but answered all questions we put to them though you got the impression you were disturbing them. The room was clean and adequate for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel to use as a base for your sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: Joc84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Champerret Elysees for 5 days last week and we were really pleased with the hotel. It's located a 10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe, between the Pereire and Porte de Champerret Metro stops. The hotel itself was tidy and did the job for what we required (basically somewhere to sleep and get changed!). The rooms were well cleaned and were tidied at least once a day. We also went for the breakfast package and were more than happy with the continental breakfast on offer (croissants, cereals, coffee machine, breads, preserves, ham/salami). Fussy people could probably argue that it could have done with being a bit closer to the main attractions, but you get what you pay for and we were more than the hotel. Would definitely recomment to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, ok price”
Reviews.Author: ArabellaMarx
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a small lift. WC in one small closet, shower and sink in another one (other side of the room). The room was really small and we barely had space to walk around the two single beds pushed together (we wanted one double bed, but that^s what we got). They had flat screen tv. Small closet, ok safe. One day we woke up later than usual and the cleaning lady kept trying the door with some violence. I realize they have to do their job, but quit shaking the door knob already! We left the room as soon as we could that day. Breakfast room is very charming, breakfast was great with a lot of options of breads, cold meat, yoghurt, milk, cereal, coffee, etc. Front desk staff very helpful and friendly, this one 30-something gentleman helped us every time, explaining how to get places since we didn't have much time to research earlier. Wi-fi in bedroom was 2,50 euros per 2 hours. Metro stations: there's one right across the street, another one walking about 5 minutes. Great neighborhood, we loved to walk back to the hotel at the end of the day. Though we couldn't find many good restaurants nearby; and no supermarket at all around, the only one we found was about 10-15 minutes walk. For electronics we found a Fnac nearby (10 minute walk) , and after we found a way to Arc de Triomphe in about 10 minutes as well we would walk there everyday and go from there, including to Louvre Museum. Only thing is I found the room a little bit noisy, we could hear our neighbors, so I wouldn't recommend this one for a honeymoon! The price was okay, but it was high season so I guess they have better rates in low season.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little hotel for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Geepy
Reviews.Content: Having looked at other similar priced hotels on trip advisor, and shuddered, we plumped for this one with fingers crossed. Our bedroom was clean, beds very comfortable. Bathroom with all mod cons, and then some. The shower had 4 variations of water direction! Must mention David from reception. This lovely man helped us plan our daily excursions and was always ready with advice about where to eat, which bus or metro to get etc. Breakfast was continental, but plentiful. The hotel location was quiet and very pleasant, importantly we felt safe, even late at night. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Devonshirediver
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location with the Eiffel Tower in walking distance and the Metro a 100m away. The staff were effective and approachable. The room was compact but had everything we required. The shower is great as was the free safe. The bed was comfortable and we slept well - that might be to do with the amount of walking we did though! There are quite a few restaurants nearby where the food is OK but expensive. The taxi from Charles de Gaul airport was 50 euro’s. We considered catching a train but there was a very long queue. There are self service ticket machines which we thought would be complicated. We should not have worried as there is the option for the instructions to be in English, and next time we would catch the train to Gare du Nord and use the Metro to Porte de Champerret were the hotel is just 100m away. We enjoyed our stay in Paris and would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but...”
Reviews.Author: Josh41
Reviews.Content: The location was quiet and safe and very close to the Metro station. The hotel was fairly basic but clean and not very noisy. We booked the superior double room so we expected a bigger room but it was actually quite small as the bed was. The decor was also a bit tired. I suppose there is no difference beetween superior or normal room as the room we tayed was very small anyway. For the same price in different city you can find 5 star hotels easily. I recommend this hotel only because it is in a good location easy access to metro. I cannot say hotel is great it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: r_poppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Eurostar mini-break deal - under £200 pp for the travel plus 3 nights B&B. I normally try to book travel & accomodation independently but this was as good as any deal as I could create for myself. As Paris first-timers the hotel was easy enough to get to using the Metro and within sight of the Porte de Champerret station. It was 15 minutes walk from Arc de Triomphe and the top of Champs Elysee and using the Metro we could get to any of the main tourist spots within about 20 minutes. There are a few nice bars & restaurants close to the hotel but the chances are that, like us, you would only go to them on the way to or from the hotel. The area is reasonably upmarket and pleasant but there is nothing there to make it a destination in itself. From the moment we arrived the staff were very helpful and spoke good English. We had forgetten to bring a travel plug and they lent us one without charge - little things like this can mean a lot. The room was not huge but big enough, with plenty of storage for a short break and all very clean. The separate toilet & bathroom were modern and the shower was an excellent multi-directional thing. The safe in the room was useful and nice not to be charged extra for it. It is a shame there were no tea & coffee making facilities in the room though - especially as they are expensive in the bar and it is made clear that food & drink are not to be taken to the rooms. Also the walls were a bit thin - we could hear next door's TV and were kept awake one night by a group of shrieking girlies two doors down. The bed felt like a cheap springy mattress which was OK for me but my partner found it uncomfortable. Likewise the pillows were of the soft & puffy but ultimately thin type. Breakfast was OK. If I had wanted a fry up I would have been out of luck but there was a reasonable choice of ham / cheese, croissants, toast (including brioche), yoghurt, cereals, fruit salad. Not 5 star but enough there to fill up on before heading out. The bar area was quite pleasant & comfortable. Drinks were expensive, although no more so than in the surrounding bars & restaurants. Overall we wanted a clean, friendly base for exploring Paris over three days on a fairly limited budget. In every area that mattered this hotel was ideal for the job.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: llcelsie
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all that has been said about this hotel, it is clean, friendly and quiet at night. Absolutely ideal placement, an easy walk to the Champs Elyseese. Breakfast was good, there was plenty of it. We bought Paris Visite tickets, 3 days for 20 euros each - unlimited travel on metro, train and bus plus there were some very good discounts on places to see. We loved Musee de Previn - French version of Madame Tussauds, The Pantheon - based on the Parthenon in Rome and Notre Dame. If you are going on a short break make sure it includes a week day - thelines to get into places at weekends are very long! If you like hot chocolate you'll love the French version - a jug of melted chocolate and a jug of hot milk - enough for two cupfuls.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: Toptrekkers
Reviews.Content: 3 night break spent here - nice and quiet. Room reasoanably sized and clean. Separate toilet and shower room very well presented. Only downside was that I reported the room safe was locked and no one bothered to unlock it for us throughout our stay. About 15mins walk to the Arc de Triomphe. No tea and coffee making facilities in the room but I understand 'this isn't a french thing.'

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pixie2296
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel for a short stay. We had 3 nights for the price of 2, breakfast included. The room was quite small but perfectly adequate for our needs as we were out so much, lovely and clean with a great shower. In a nice area, with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and, as everyone says, the metro is a stones throw from the hotel entrance and is so easy to use for getting around the city. The reception staff we met had very good English and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All we could have hoped for plus more”
Reviews.Author: DevonMax
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I booked a 3 night stay in Paris through GreatGetaways (£168 each) which included travel with Eurostar. (Got back a few hours go) After a lot of research on TripAdvisor we decided to go with the Champerret Elysees & i can see we were definitely not disappointed. Hotel: First impressions were excellent.. the reception area is very classy & clean & the guy on the desk was very welcoming. The whole hotel was spotless. Breakfast was what i would expect, beautiful croissants & a beautiful room downstairs, attended to by friendly, uniformed breakfast staff. Room: We were on the 2nd floor (no.210) & the room was surprisingly big compared to what we thought it would be. I later noticed that it was a 'superior' room & i think that may have been down to the fact that i specifically asked for a room with a bath & the fact that the hotel wasn't too busy. Although the area around the bed was ample, the bathroom was tiny & the toilet was separate. Flatscreen TV only showed a couple English speaking channels (Sky News & BBC World). In terms of sleeping, you couldn't hear a pin drop & the temperature & comfort was perfect. Location: Perfect location. Not in the center where its dirty & noisy but perfectly situated up in the North West, 30 seconds away from the Metro station, Porte De Champerret. The area is just lovely, with a nice atmosphere & full of amazing restaurants. The Arc De Triomphe is literally 15 mins walk away. In all, i'm usually very articulate & picky about all aspects of a holiday & i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.. especially couples. Recommendations: - The Metro system is a simple, convenient, cheap way to get around. Print a Metro map from the net. In terms of getting to & from the hotel, If you're traveling via Eurostar, buy a one-way single each time (€1.60) instead of a day pass (€5.80). - The prices generally are ridiculous i.e €3.50 for a can of coke €7 for a baguette so be wise & take advantage of any Supermarkets you see around. - Going up the Eiffel tower is a lot cheaper if you walk rather than get the lift (€3.50). The Louvre Museum is closed on Tuesdays & is free for EU Citizens below the age of 26 (also applies to the Arc De Triomphe) - Make sure you go to the top of the Arc De Triomphe at night.. the view is breath-taking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: The Teacher7
Reviews.Content: Like some other reviewers, we stayed here on the basis of other Tripadvisor members and we were not disappointed. We'd managed to get a 3 nights for the price of 2 from the Airmiles website, including breakfast (which is 15 Euros per person if you don't have it included with the room). The hotel is about a 30 min walk from the Etoile/Champs Elysees, but a 2 min walk from the nearest metro station. The metro is very very easy to get around on and quite cheap. So, the room was small - but we weren't expecting much space. There was a wardrobe space, which included a safety deposit box. The tv included BBC World News, which is all you need when you're out and about sightseeing! The bathroom was tiny, as was the (separate) toilet, but both were incredibly clean and had everything that we needed. Our room looked onto a residential street - flats etc. It was incredibly quiet, probably helped by the double glazing... Sheets and towels were changed every day. I don't think we could really fault the room. The people on the front desk were all very helpful and we were able to leave our bags at Reception on our final day before we headed back to the airport. Breakfast was buffet style, which seemed to be quite extensive in its selection. You could go up as many times as you liked, so you didn't really need lunch - unless you did loads of walking (as we did - that's my excuse and I'm sticking to it!!!). We'd definitely stay here again, if we were to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in July 09. We chose to come here on the strength of the other Trip Advisor write ups and we were not disappointed. The desk staff were very helpful and efficient. The check-in was easy and took about 1 minute. The room was small but was clean and serviced every day. We had breakfast on one morning and the other mornings we had breakfast at nearby restaurants. The breakfast was continental and was ok. The hotel is located in a very good area with the Metro just one minute walk. I reported the toilet seat loose and the shower head had nothing to hold it on the wall. This was on the first morning (room 208) but nothing was done about in during our stay. I didnt push it as we were not in the room that much. But all in all I would still recommend this very good value hotel. Just on a footnote about Paris. We really enjoyed out five days. This was the second time we had been to Paris. First time 2001. Everywhere to eat is very expensive. I think in tourist hot spots they charge what they like for teas, coffees, food and alcohol. It has to be the most expensive place in Europe. Jim and Bridgeen Rea Belfast Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel for very little cash!”
Reviews.Author: Yaffle
Reviews.Content: We were given a friendly and cheerful welcome and were happy with our compact twin room. Very good shower and spotlessly clean. Beds changed everyday, air con, quiet room in the back with good double glazing too. Breakfast was basic but fine-just make sure you get down to the breakfast room well before 10am,as the lady looking after it closes up spot on 10! If bread or cheese etc is low, ask the waitress to re-fill, or she may not do it! No problem when we asked! The hotel was easy to find from the metro [2 mins walk] and 15 mins walk to L`arc de Triomphe. A nice area close to the hotel with some good little restaurants-we ate in `San Remo`[pizza/pasta] one evening which proved to be pretty much the best value place to eat that we found during our stay-under 10 E for most mains. A great base for our trip at a very good price!

Reviews.Title: “Met our Paris Weekend Needs”
Reviews.Author: GFGManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in June to sightsee. There are 2 metros / train station within 10mins walking distance & lots of buses stop nearby. Our first room was on the first floor & after unpacking we realised the air con was leaking. The reception allowed us to swap rooms. Had this not happened, I dont think the stay would have been as comfortable. Our new room was clean & was a base to rest our heads after long, lovely days of sightseeing. If you want base & are happy to walk & use public transport to get to the main tourist attractions then this hotel is fine. There are many brasseries etc nearby but be prepared to pay the rather expensive prices for an evening meal. We had one of the 'best pizzas in Paris' in the cafe / snack bar at the main roundabout as you come out the hotel & turn right. The cafe / snack bar doesnt look much but is great to sit outside & people watch. The breakfast was ok & is as we expected for the price. If we went to Paris again we would revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find, Excellent Location, Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: AFRO_Travel_Fun
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 4 day trip to Paris, our very first time and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We arrived at CDG on Friday 26th June and took the RER B train to Gare du Nord station, we picked up the Metro and changed once to then go on to Porte de Champerret station. As we walked out of the station then hotel was about a 20 meter walk away. When we arrived, the hotel lobby looked very appealing and the reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful. (Please do not believe all you read or hear about Parisians) - we found everyone wonderful, in fact it was the ignorant English speaking tourists that expected the French to communicate in our language and not the other way around. We don't speak fluent French, but we made sure we tried our hardest to attempt as much of their language as we could. I think the Parisians really appreciate you trying. Please do take time to look at the video trailer for this hotel as it is exactly as you see it. The hotel should be listed higher than a 3 star as the place was clean and relatively modern. The lounge area was nice and the restaurant was great, we had inclusive buffet style breakfast with enough coffee, juice, croissants, rolls, cheese and ham, cup cakes and fruit salad to fill yourself up before you embark on the wonderful sight seeing. What can I say.... The weather was beautiful and the sights even more so. We absolutely loved Paris, from the Arc de Triumph just up the road to the late night sightseeing cruise with Bateux Parisiens (http://www.bateauxparisiens.com/EN/boats-cruises-paris-seine-uk.html). €11 euros for an hour. You start the tour from the Eiffel Tower, go under Alexandre III bridge and on to view the Old Train station which is now a museum, then past the Louvre on to Notre Damne before the boat circles around an island a doubles back. We did the cruise in the day first but on our last night we decided to go back to experience it at nightime. We left the dock at 11pm and the Eiffel Tower sparkles like a huge christmas tree, its spectacular. It only happens on the hour and we were fortunate to see it go off twice, once again when we returned at Midnight. Another great place to go and see is Basilique Sacré-Coeur de Montmartre. Its a wonderful Catholique church right at the very top of this hill and the views across Paris are amazing. There is a little square past the church that has a number of shops and restaurants that serve lovely food and alot cheaper than in the centre of Paris. Aritsans Square as it is called is filled with Artists displaying their art work. The perfect place to get a self portrait and you can haggle them down, in fact I was told they expect it. This was a great day out and I could have stayed so much longer. I can't wait to return to Paris one day and I will definately be happy to stay at the Champerret Elysees hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ****”
Reviews.Author: sionpc
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. Location to all the attractions is great, you can walk to them if you like and would recommend it as you see so much more of Paris. The Hotel was Clean and the hotel staff were excellent and were there to help to all I questions and needs. The hotel is very close to a Metro station gor those who don't like to walk and this can get you anywhere you want to in paris. We will definately use this hotel next time we come back.. Much more rated than it should be..

Reviews.Title: “...tiny, but nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: tomizghrv
Reviews.Content: Great location and really nice hotel... Friendly employees....

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tiny!”
Reviews.Author: dottie_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate my birthday. This hotel is ideally located near the Metro and within walking distance of bars and restaurants as well as attractions. I'd not been to Paris for 30 years and was shocked at the cost of living. This is a very expensive city. Tracking down a reasonably priced cup of Americano coffee was immensely difficult - most bars/cafes sold them around 5 euros! Eating out too is astronomical, I'd read in a guide book that it's more economical to eat lunch and many places did offer deals, although some tried to rip us off! As for the hotel itself, yes, the place is spotless and staff friendly but ignore their totally misleading website. On it, beds are described as queensize but I'd say they're more like a small double, very cramped and we also found the sheets and bedding really make you sweat. I didn't sleep at all well over the 3 nights we stayed. The rooms too are tiny, although the hotel's website makes them look big. We had the smallest wardrobe in the world. There is also no bath and no cooked breakfast as described on the website - that to me was a big disappointment. We loved the modern shower though, with its body jets and constant hot water and the view from the top floor was great for people-watching . Walls are paper thin and after a noisy night awoken by the people upstairs, we swapped our original 3rd floor room to one on the top floor which was far better. The swap was arranged by the staff without fuss. We were also allowed to check in early on arrival, allowing us more time for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Chittenden
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Champerret Elysees after an overnight train journey from Venice, and were greeted by such a friendly receptionist who let us check ito our room although it was still a few hours before the scheduled check-in time. The room was small but clean and comfortable, and perfect for our needs since we weren't planning on spending our time in Paris in our hotel room! The hotel is in a really great location, about 2minutes walk from the Metro. There is also a fantastic little patisserie between the hotel and the metro, which was always a handy stop to pick up a delicious croissant for breakfast:) We really enjoyed our stay here, particularly because of the receptionist who always offered a smile and a chat (and a quick French lesson) whenever we arrived or left. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy a comfortable night after some sightseeing in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: ranlew
Reviews.Content: We took the advice of TripAdvisor on this one for a stay of 3 nights and we were disappointed. The room was small and the TV and air-conditioning didn't work and the bath drained very slowly that meant during a shower, the water was around your ankles. We called for assistance but were told they couldn't do anything until morning and to open the window for cooling. When the window was opened it was very noisy so we had to close the window and swelter. The next day upon returning to the room, the problems had still not been rectified and the soap dispensers had run out of soap. The following day the hotel offered us another room with air-conditioning that did not work and a bed light missing so we kept our original room. The next and final day the TV was repaired. On the plus side the reception staff were always pleasant and our luggage was stored after checkout and the hotel is very close to the Metro and Eateries. If the problems had been rectified at the beginning it would have been good accommodation but I think next time I would look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything to praise, nothing to fault”
Reviews.Author: true4u
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arranged a break in Paris to celebrate my birthday. Unfortunately as my birthday is so close to Christmas we were on a bit of a budget and so looked tirelessly for good deals with hotels, hoping that they would at least be able to provide a good clean base from which to explore Paris. By choosing to stay at this hotel, for just 75 euros a night through their website promotion, all our expectations were met and by far exceeded. We had a standard room which had all that was needed to make a comfortable and relaxing stay: A mirrored wardrobe; a desk and chair; a seperate chair; a flatscreen tv; 2 bedside tables with lamps; a neat, comfy double bed and plenty of space to accommodate our luggage. In addition, the bathroom, while fairly compact, was beautifully clean with an outstanding shower, so luxurious it was hard to get out of! The toilet was separate which is always practical when there is more than one traveler. And to top it all, everything was cleaned and tidied immaculately each day. The room also felt very private, with little awareness of other visitors to the hotel. Along with the courteous and helpful manner of the hotel staff, the brilliant location with regards to the Metro and being within close proximity to all sorts of restaurants and attractions, this hotel will surely be revisited on any further trips we decide to take to Paris, as well as highly recommended to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shed123
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for weekend getaway, could not fault it. From Gare du Nord on Metro, easy peasy ! Location is spot on, only a few yards from the Metro, can get to all the sights of Paris in a few minutes. Clean, bright and tidy hotel, friendly staff, nice rooms, decent breakfast, comfy bar, what more do you want for the price! S & A Quorn Leics

Reviews.Title: “Hot hot hot - but not in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: thewalrus73
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for this hotel after reading the reviews, but perhaps we should have lowered our expectations slightly! We'd booked the hotel as part of a package that included Eurostar travel. We'd emailed the hotel in advance asking for a quiet room. Upon arrival we were allocated a room on the top floor. It was listed as a 'superior' room, but it was difficult to see why. The room was a pretty good size for Paris, and there was a flat screen TV, but the decor was a little tired - it really was nothing special. The bathroom was clean, but unlike previous reviewers' experiences, it had not been newly renovated and there was no multi-jet shower - although the shower was hot and powerful, the shower hose did not attach to the wall, which was rather inconvienient. Our room faced the back of the hotel, so we had no view, and outside our window there was a large and noisy generator, so not exactly the quiet room that we had requested. A room facing onto a side street would have been more peaceful and much more pleasant. We visited in August and it was very hot - expecting this, we had paid extra for a hotel with air conditioning. However, it soon became apparent that it was just recirculating air rather than cooling it. The room became very hot overnight - our thermometer said 30 degrees. We could not open the window because of the noisy generator outside - ironic that it was probably an air con unit so at least some people were getting cooled air! We asked the receptionist about it the next day and were told that we needed to set the temperature at no less than 19 degrees - bit illogical. But doing so made no difference. It turned out that the air con unit needed to be reset. This was not done until our third day - I have no idea why the receptionist could not have arranged for this to be done as soon as we mentioned it as apparently it was a simple job. So we had a few hours of blissful coolness on day 3 before the unit packed in again overnight, despite us following the instructions. So, three unbearably hot nights did not endear us to Champerret Elysees. On the plus side, the breakfast was pretty decent if you can get it as part of a deal - wouldn't have paid the 13 Euros they otherwise charge. The food didn't run out at all, as mentioned in previous reviews. The location was also good - although a little out of the centre, it was very close to the metro station and there were some nice cafes, restaurants and shops nearby. We didn't let our experience at the hotel put us off Paris - in fact we probably spent longer in the Louvre admiring the paintings because it was so much cooler than in our hotel - standing on an air vent was pure bliss!! The best part of the trip was actually the journey, as we had managed to get a deal with a free upgrade to Leisure Select on Eurostar - I'd highly recommend this; great (complimentary) food and they were also generous with the free wine and champers!!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Chorizogolf
Reviews.Content: Other Tripadvisor members are absolutely right. This was a cracking little hotel for our short stay in Paris. The room was compact, but with a very comfortble bed and a superb power shower. Everything worked, the towels were changed daily and the buffet breakfast gave us the necessary fuel for serious walking. The hotel (our room was very quiet) is situated quite close to the end of the Metro line, but it takes less than 20 minutes to get to the main sights. And, whatever your taste in food, it can be satisfied within five minutes of the hotel: French brasseries, high quality fish restaurants, Indian, Chinese, Thai and Vietnamese for those who like Asian fare, two Italian restaurants, two steakhouses and even a Russian joint. If we return to Paris we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrMeaker
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days at the Champerret Elysees hotel. A great little hotel that looks a little tatty from the outside, but inside is excellent. The staff are friendly and very helpful, the rooms are a decent size (comparable to anything in London), our toilet was small (although how big does it really need to be) but the shower was great. Extremely close to the Metro station making it very easy to get round Paris. We didn't have breakfast there, instead opting for the very nice pastry shop just by the Metro entrance. All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore Champerret Elysees!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelbuddies
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here last week for 2 nights. was pleasantly surprised at how close the hotel was to the metro (just across the road!) where you could get to all the attractions. Staff at hotel were extremely polite and helpful and spoke good english. The twin room was bigger than i had expected, as was the bathroom! Towels and bed linen was changed everyday and rooms cleaned which was nice. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel as there are plenty of pattiseries along the street. We ate at Roy's (opposite the hotel) as was recommended on here and loved it (16 euros for a drink, main and dessert) Overall loved our stay and would def return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: LDN2001
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel for a city trip. Immaculate clean room. Powerful shower with massage jets. Excellent Price. Reception spoke English. Great location, easy walking distance to Arc de Triomphe (and if your feelling fit the Effiel Tower). 1 minute walk from a Metro station. Good buffet continental breakfast. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: womack48
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five day trip to Paris having used this property for the duration of our stay. I found the hotel to be perfectly located. A 20 min. walk via Ave's Neil and Mc mahon take you to the Arc de Triomphe. There are lots of small Restaurants in the area which are of good quality. For those who wish to economise or with small children a McDonalds is also approx 100 mtrs away. The metro Line 3 is also approx. 100 mtrs from the front door which takes you direct to Opera Garnier in the centre of Paris from where you can change to the various lines depending on your intended destination. For a short stay I would recommend for convienience that you purchase a visitors pass for 3 or 5 days. Individual journeys are cheap but if you intend to make a lot then they can add up. The hotel was perfect. Small rooms like the majority of paris hotels. Both room and bathroom spotless. Free room safe and air conditioning. Large selection for continental style breakfast and lots of it. All in all a perfect stay and will return to the Champerret Elysees

Reviews.Title: “A 3 Star Hotel?? I Don't Know”
Reviews.Author: Jarda007
Reviews.Content: Room is tiny, we missed some space inside of the toilet-tables and inside of the big table too. Your toilet room with WC was extremely small, we coudn´t turn around. There was a reconstruction in the hotel, we were disturbed by a huge noise. We had a terrible view from the window (viz. enclosed photograph). The dinning room and the hotel´s location - very nice. General impression: when we compare the other three-star hotels in Europe - standard, with three-star hotels in south-east and east Asia ( Singapur, Hongkong, Bali)- very huge substandard and with three star hotels in Africa (Egypt, Tunisia) - above standard.

Reviews.Title: “A good, if unspectacular, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheshiretravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2008 having read previous reviews on tripadvisor, and I think that some previous reviewers have got carried away with the romance of Paris in giving it such high scores! The Hotel is in a nice area, and it is true that you can stroll to the Arc de Triomphe in 20 minutes. And it is handily placed next to Porte de Champerret Metro station. Whilst this was convenient, to get to Notre Dame/St.Michel area still took 30 minutes which we found was the best (yet most touristy) place to eat. The room itself however was unspectacular - it was hot - and when we booked in we even had to change rooms as our allocated room hadn't been cleaned (I had never come across this before...and it was 4 o'clock in the afternoon). Next time I go to Paris I will stay someone closer to one of the main attractions (there were several nice hotels by the Arc de Triomphe or on the Left bank).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalli1999
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Paris and we were not disappointed. We were there for 4 nights and the Hotel was excellent. There is a virtual video on the hotel's website and what you see is exactly what it is like. It was very clean and the room was cleaned and fresh towels every day. The hotel is within walking distance of the shuttle bus terminal and the metro is only a few yards away. We were booked for bed and breakfast only and there was always plenty to choose from. Would recommend this hotel, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: scotfam
Reviews.Content: Our party of 3 women and 4 boys (8yrs - 13yrs) found that his hotel ticked all the boxes for us. We arrived at Beauvais airport and this hotel is a comfortable 15minute walk from the bus drop off point. The hotel is freshly decorated and spotlessly clean. Rooms are small but not claustrophobic. We booked with Hotels Direct and got a breakfast inclusive rate which was good value. The continental breakfast was of a good standard with lovely fresh croissants, breads, cold meats, cheeses, jam etc. Porte Champerret Metro station is a few yards from the hotel entrance and we were able to access connections to all parts of the city from there. The surrounding area felt safe and there is a good choice of local cafes and restaurants to eat in at night. The hotel has only a small lounge area but it is very pleasant and we enjoyed a bedtime cuppa there at night. We would definately stay in this hotel again if using Beauvais airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Crackin Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leprechaun2008
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful weekend in glorious Paris. Book for a 3 night stay in the champerret elysees hotel. As this was our first time visiting Paris it took us a wee while to actually find the hotel, as it is on Avenue De Villiers, which is quite a long road (to be honest though it was partly down to my map reading skills) We arrived at the hotel at 11.30am, and thought we would chance our arms in the hope we could drop our bags there and head bag out, and check in when we came back later. However, and to our plesent surpirse when we were greeted by the man at reception, who had excellent english in comparison to our french, he informed us that the smoking room which I had booked was not ready, but there was a non-smoking room which was available straight away, so we were happy to take that, as my partner had given up smoking since I had booked! The hotel is the normal small but quaint parisienne hotel that you might expect, but had obviously just been recently renovated. The rooms are small but prefect for 2, especially if your heading out to do the tourist thing. Spotlessly clean, and nice and warm at night and with an LCD tv and hairdryer. We never ate in the hotel, and chose to eat out while sightseeing. The bar was quiet at night, but I was only haveing the one or 2 while waiting on my partner to get ready, it was just the job. The nearest metro is literally 40 meters from the front door, so all of Paris is pretty much at your disposal from there! Make sure you check out a pastry at the little shop at the top of the metro stairs. All in all, our stay in Paris was brilliant, and only helped by the fantastic hotel and its friendly staff, if we go back to Paris we would definately book back in to the champerret elysees hotel. P.s. If you are planning a break in Paris to do the sights, April is a wonderful time, less queues, less crowds ans less hassle than I'd imagine there would be in the summer (were told freinds queued for the major attractions like the Lourve for 2/3 hours, and the Eiffel Tower for 2, where we strolled straight into the Lourve and only waited 30 mins for the trip to the top of the Tower)

Reviews.Title: “A good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smoda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and friendly. It is small though and the bedrooms are also small. But that said, the rooms were warm, clean and modern. No shower curtain in the shower. The price is the main attraction of this hotel. It is a 3 star hotel, no more or no less, but a good 3 star hotel and worth the money. The breakfast is ok, not bad, 15 euro per person per sitting. The staff were all helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Ruth_UK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the C.E Hotel and loved it. The hotel is situated in a quieter part of Paris, but with good links (the metro line 3 is only a stones throw from the hotel or its a ten minute walk to the arc de triomph). First impressions of the hotel are good, the lobby is nice and the staff very welcoming, they also speak good English! We had a superior room, which was a good size for a city hotel room, it was also very clean and had adequate amenities such as a tv and room safe, plus a comfortable bed. We slept well, and there was no noise from outside. However the one gripe would be that the walls are very thin and therefore the room upstairs' shower woke us early one morning. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but plenty of cafes nearby. Also would recommend Roy's Cafe opposite the hotel. We had a lovely evening meal there on the first night. The hotels bar is also a good setting for a night cap. All in all would recommend this hotel as excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn138
Reviews.Content: Did all my research on Trip Advisor before our 4 day break in Paris - Hotel puts many other 4 star plus hotels to shame, and the the Champerret is only 3star. From checking in, amazing customer service, nothing was too much of a problem , reception staff were so helpful, room suited us fine, breakfast was great. Found the hotel very clean and tidy. Plus points - so near the Metro, great to travel around the city , don't forget to go to Roy's Bar across the road - couldn't fault the meal - and the wine ...for only 31 Euros. Small supermarket up the road for those bits you will have forgotten. The 2 day pass - Yellow bus open top bus again wonderful value - we saw so much of the city in such a short amount of time. We will certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: BUCEPHALES
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel 3/3-7/3/08.It more than lived up to the reviews on tripadvisor. Immaculately clean all over the hotel and friendly welcoming staff who were always on hand for assistance and advice. Our room 206 (a standard room)was well appointed and superb value for money,matching 4 star quality we have experienced in other city hotels. From room safe,flat screen tv,very comfortable beds,quiteness,to the well appointed shower-room with hair dryer and even tissues, it could not have been bettered(although the seperate toilet was a little snug-but then again one doesn't tend to spend a lot of time in there). Breakfasts were the best we have had any where at this level of hotel.Marvellous selection of cereals, breads,meats, croisssants,jams,poached eggs,bacon,sausagesetc. The hotel had a comfortable bar where we relaxed on returning from doing the sites with a lovely coffee or something stronger at good prices.A good selection of snacks were also available. It's position with regards to the tourist sites is another winner. The metro is only 50 meters to the left as you come out the door and the bus station if you prefer is not much further up the road. We strolled to Arc de Triomphe in 18minutes(we're in our 60's) and then down the length of the Champs Elysees in an hour. What more could you want? The immediate area is safe and you are surrounded by all grades of restaurants although most nights we ate at the excellent value Roy's over the road-thankyou to others who also recommended that eaterie. We wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaydeeReading
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from Paris staying at the Champerret Elysees. The hotel is quite central to many restaurants and within walking distance of many sights. The bedrooms are very comfortable with an excellent en suite. The whole of the hotel is scrupulously clean. We would certainly go back .................

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antonio98
Reviews.Content: Had a thoroughly comfortable stay here. Staff were very friendly and always willing to help. Also very knowledgable about Paris and various tourist attractions. Location was pretty good, literally 20 seconds walk to the Metro station and a 5-10 min journey to Charles de Gaulle. Overall very pleased and would certainly reccomend/return.

Reviews.Title: “This place was fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: StoneSaver
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful! We booked a budget room and crossed our fingers. After reading several bad reviews on other hotels and hostels on TripAdvisor, I decided to trust the reviews on this place as they were all good. I was looking for a place that was near a Metro station, had a lift, was clean, affordable, and had good reviews; I found all that and more at Champerret Elysees. The Metro station is about a block away, the neighborhood is clean, quiet, and lovely, and all the places we ate nearby were delicious and affordable. The hotel is very nice with a clean, elegant lobby and very friendly and helpful staff. They let us check in 2 hours early since our room was ready which made us quite happy. As I've said, the room was clean and a good size by European standards. The shower was ample with plenty of hot water and the bathroom had clean linens which were changed daily. There was a flat screen television which made viewing the movies-on-demand very nice. The mattress was good and firm. Our window had a flower box with REAL flowers and a view onto the street that was absolutely charming. We stayed in 302 which was a budget room with a double bed. There is no doubt that I will return to this hotel again and again and again! If you can, try the restaurant across the street from the hotel. The food was delicious, the wine very good, and the prices affordable. We hope you enjoy it all as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MrStump
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 5 nights during our first visit to Paris. While we really only used to room to sleep in, we couldn't fault it. The staff were friendly despite us not speaking any French. The hotel is in walking distance from where the bus from Beauvais airport ends (we flew with Ryanair). There is an underground metro railway line almost outside the hotel; Roys Cafe across the street is highly recommended - we ate there most nights. A three course meal with wine costs about 35 euros each; and even an excellent McDonalds close by - we can recommend their breakfasts. The room was on the small side but very clean and comfortable. On our next visit we will probably stay somewhere different but that is no reflection on the hotel. Other recommendations are the metro; a two-day hop-on-hop-off bus ticket; a cruise on the Seine and of course the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ardmacha
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nites in hotel the room was small but we were only in it to sleep very clean and well run staff friendly,breakfast was 15 euro each good if you like bread chesse and ham etc .arch was only ten min away, found a nice place were we enjoyed eating to the right of hotel on a roundabout , le royal pereire. loved their chicken and apple tart and coffee for 14 euro. went to the boat trip on metro just beside hotel, that was fun as no help at station so go single 1.50e each and back single but remember to watch stops cause we got bit lost , but had good day out and some shopping along the way part of the fun we went to prix de arc de triomphe on the sunday (horse racing) at longchamp fantastic place got a cab for 13 euros as could not find free bus but came back on free bus ten min walk back to hotel so good day out , would go back to hotel and bring some friends next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Champerret Elysees ”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandBuddy
Reviews.Content: Champerret Elysees Paris Date 17rh July 2007 Irish Visitor-Derry My family and I have just returned from a fantastic 4 day visit to Paris. It was our first time there and the hotel is in a fantastic location. There are plenty of shops, cafes etc around the hotel-even a Mc Donalds! The hotel itself is basic but very clean and comfortable. The staff are very pleasent and very helpful. The hotel is central to any place you would want to go. The surrounding area is very friendly and safe. We hope to go back there some time in the future again.

Reviews.Title: “Call off the hotel search!!This is the one!”
Reviews.Author: MLJB
Reviews.Content: Champerret Elysees is an overall fantastic hotel. Great rooms, service, and location. Our stay was only 2 nights, but it was wonderful. The rooms were nicely furnished, a very large comfortable bed, a desk, 2 nightstands, and a great flat screen tv which you should be too tired to watch from all of your traveling. Other great features of the room were the shower and the air conditioning which were both exceptional. Also, the size of the room was very spacious, a lot larger than our room in London. We had a room facing the street, noise was definitely not a problem, and the view was nice. The location is great, about 1 minute away from the metro station( Porte de Champerret), and about a 15 minute walk to the Champs Elysees. While we expected the staff to be a little better with English than they actually were, they were still very very helpful and friendly. Another great service that the hotel offers is a luggage storage room, which allowed us to store our bags in between the time of check out and our train departure. This was great because we were able to have that day without the burden of our bags. The hotel also has a full service bar and food, which we were to busy to try or even take a picture of . But their pictures don't lie, everything looks exactly as they show it in their advertisements. One more thing, there is a great little street bakery right next to the metro station, we never got the name, but when you come out, it is to the left and it is to die for. The hotel was a little over a budget travel price, but search around and find a great deal, because it definitely doesn't look or feel like a budget hotel. Champerret Elysees was an amazing pick for a hotel in Paris, it made our experience that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: JamieLemon
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, a lovely size and clean and tidy. The hotel is clean, the staff have great english and are friendly, breakfast was simple but ideal, its a minute from the Metro. Spent 4 nights here with my girlfriend and we'd love to go back and are recommendin it to all our friends! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice. It was clean and fresh looking, rooms had nice and bright interiour. Had a plasma screen television aswell. The buffet breakfast room and food were both lovely. The metro station is right outside your front door and the metroline after a few stops connects onto all main lines to the attractions so it's handy. About ten/fifteen min walk to the champs elyeses itself. Not a bad area from what I saw, few restaurants close by and a little supermarket. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Champerret Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 129 avenue de Villiers | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
